title: Ticket #1919: support streaming output in condor_q to reduce memory usage
description:
condor_q reads all ads into memory before generating any output. This is intended to prevent the schedd from getting blocked by condor_q being blocked on output. However, this also means that very large queues require a lot of memory for condor_q, even if all it is doing is dumping the ads to a file. If memory runs low and swapping results, then the schedd can get blocked anyway.

We ran into this problem on glow.cs.wisc.edu. condor_q is periodically run to monitor demand. The code that measures demand carefully avoids ever needing to have all of the jobs in memory, but it relies on condor_q to fetch the ads and dump them in a file, so any schedd with a large job queue can cause trouble.

Proposed Solution

Add -stream-results option to condor_q. This will cause it to generate output as each ad is fetched.
